text: hey all, I'm working on migrating a repurposed blog to hubdb and noticed there is not a meta description field for dynamic pages. Anyone figure out how to replace the meta description on dynamic pages?
I can add a new column and add an if statement to the head no problem. but then I'll have two meta descriptions
one idea is to use javascript to update the meta description on the dynamic pages but that seems  pretty smelly. is there anyone that has done this any other way?
<@U6GNQ7JBU> any insight would be appreciated :slightly_smiling_face:
Let me see
I may have a solution, let me test it first
that'd be awesome <@U6GNQ7JBU>!
<@U6GNQ7JBU> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U6GNQ7JBU/F8KLADS3U/-.txt|Untitled>
However this doesn't set the `og:description`. I wonder if this should be a built-in column, similar to hs_name/hs_path, that you have the option to set and it just works
yeah seems like a good idea since that's what you're already doing with the page title.
<@U7V9DQ31P> commented on <@U6GNQ7JBU>’s file <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U6GNQ7JBU/F8KLADS3U/-.txt|https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U6GNQ7JBU/F8KLADS3U/-.txt>: I'll try this out. Thanks!

<@U7V9DQ31P> commented on <@U6GNQ7JBU>’s file <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U6GNQ7JBU/F8KLADS3U/-.txt|https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U6GNQ7JBU/F8KLADS3U/-.txt>: does this replace the header includes meta description? or will there be 2 metas now?

comment.comment: does this replace the header includes meta description? or will there be 2 metas now?

text: <@U6GNQ7JBU> commented on <@U6GNQ7JBU>’s file <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U6GNQ7JBU/F8KLADS3U/-.txt|https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U6GNQ7JBU/F8KLADS3U/-.txt>: Only 1 in my testing. The code might check to see if the meta field is already set in the header includes.

comment.comment: Only 1 in my testing. The code might check to see if the meta field is already set in the header includes.

text: <@U6GNQ7JBU> commented on <@U6GNQ7JBU>’s file <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U6GNQ7JBU/F8KLADS3U/-.txt|https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U6GNQ7JBU/F8KLADS3U/-.txt>: And only add it if not, just double checking this now

comment.comment: And only add it if not, just double checking this now

text: <@U6GNQ7JBU> commented on <@U6GNQ7JBU>’s file <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U6GNQ7JBU/F8KLADS3U/-.txt|https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U6GNQ7JBU/F8KLADS3U/-.txt>: It appears so
<@U6GNQ7JBU> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U6GNQ7JBU/F8KLE92PL/-.txt|Untitled>
<@U7V9DQ31P> Updated/simplified solution
cool, thanks!
:raised_hands: :+1:

<@U6GNQ7JBU> may want to also do these if you add the functionality to hubdb itself ```<meta property="og:description" content="{{ dynamic_page_hubdb_row.meta_description }}">
<meta name="twitter:description" content="{{ dynamic_page_hubdb_row.meta_description }}">```
I was planning on overriding all these meta tags :slightly_smiling_face:
Hey! I'm also facing this problem with dynamic pages
<@U89KR3VJ5> pinned ’s Plain Text <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U6GNQ7JBU/F8KLE92PL/-.txt|Untitled> to this channel.
